oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Various interviews - Biff Collie - KFOX
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of interviews with Loretta Lynn (performer), Little Jimmy Dickens (performer), Tex Williams (performer), and Jerry Wallace (performer), conducted by Biff Collie (host), on radio station KFOX (Long Beach, Calif.)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Biff Collie introduces Loretta Lynn -- Loretta Lynn talks about why she started playing country music and tells a story about it -- Loretta Lynn talks about the first time she sang on the radio, forming her first band, and performing on Buck Owens show -- Lynn talks about getting to the Grand Ole Opry 3 years after starting her music career -- Lynn talks about the first time she rode in an airplane and how nervous she was -- Lynn talks about how busy she has been and that she wants to focus on family -- Lynn talks about a special dance she does called the Stone Age Twist and how at her last show she fell while dancing -- Lynn says that she is 26 at the time and talks about her 2 sons and 2 daughters -- Biff Collie concludes the interview -- Biff Collie introduces Little Jimmy Dickens -- Dickens talks about recording ballads -- Dickens thanks all his supporters -- Collie talks about how great all of Dickens work is -- Dickens talks about breaking into radio -- Collie and Dickens talk about a time when they accidentally broke into a bank -- Dickens talks about how good he feels about how nice the weather is -- Biff Collie concludes the interview -- Biff Collie introduces Tex Williams -- Williams talks about how long he has known Collie -- Collie tells a story about how Tex Williams used to work for him -- Williams adds to the story -- Williams talks about how he got his start in country music -- Williams talks about starting out with Spade Cooling in 1942 -- Williams talks about starting Western Caravan -- Williams talks about Smoke Smoke Smoke That Cigarette -- Williams talks about Jimmie Rodgers being his idol when he was young -- Williams talks about how his father was a fiddle player and he accompanied him on banjo -- Williams talks about playing with Deuce Spriggins -- Collie talks how Smoke Smoke Smoke is one of the biggest songs of all time -- Williams thanks Collie for the interview -- Collie talks about the mesh of pop and country -- Collie introduces Jerry Wallace -- Wallace talks about starting in rock and roll and moving to country and pop -- Wallace talks about growing up around country music and playing for 12 years -- Wallace talks about is musical roots -- Wallace talks about owning two publishing companies and one record label -- Wallace talks about his main interest being discovering new talent for the world to hear -- Wallace talks about his first big hit record going gold -- Collie concludes the interview -- Wallace thanks KFOX for all the radio play
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Collie, Biff; Lynn, Loretta, 1932-; Dickens, Little Jimmy, 1920-2015; Williams, Tex; Wallace, Jerry;
